channel.title: The First Run
channel.itunes:author: The First Run
channel.itunes:subtitle: Soft Core Film Talk
channel.description: The First Run is a weekly podcast featuring lively, spirited talk about film. We'll be discussing a wide variety of films including new releases, lost classics and perhaps a controversial opinion or two. So come join us for some animated conversation, that only occasionally devolves into rudimentary chimp-like poop throwing.

item.title: TFR Ep. 630: Triangle Of Sadness, Werewolf By Night, The Howling, Werewolf Marathon Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt book a cruise with the rich and decadent to visit the scenic ‘Triangle Of Sadness’! Filled with a Russian oligarchs, Weapons Manufacturers, and possibly the worst of all, Social Media Influencers, is this trip with the 2 & half hour experience? Then as a treat, it’s ‘Werewolf By Night’! Disney+’s Halloween special is a throwback to the classic Universal monster movies! But is it more a trick? The Werewolf Marathon wraps with Joe Dante’s 80’s cult classic ‘The Howling’.  Dee Wallace goes on a retreat after experiencing some severe workplace trauma, to find it hides a terrible secret. There’s the scintillating review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week. Finally, Matt and Chris close out the show with the Werewolf Marathon Awards!

00:00-13:08: Intro/Triangle Of Sadness

13:09-22:19: Werewolf By Night

22:20-36:13: Physical Media Picks

36:14-46:52: The Howling

46:53-55:19: Werewolf Marathon Awards

55:20-58:31: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 629: Black Adam, Clerks III, Wolfen, 5 Favorite View Askew Universe Characters
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt shout “Shazam!” and The Rock’s passion project ‘Black Adam’ appears in a burst of lightning, ready for our review. Is it the course correction the DCEU has been waiting for?  Then the guys make one last trip to the Quik Stop with ‘Clerks III’.  Kevin Smith revisits the much beloved convenience store in Red Bank, NJ. But can you really go home again, again? The Werewolf Marathon continues with the barely relevant, ‘Wolfen’, featuring Albert Finney facing off against urban blight, gentrification, and some really ticked off not-quite werewolves. There’s the bone-chilling breakdown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight-To-DVD picks of the week. Then Matt and Chris wrap up the show with their 5 Favorite View Askew Universe Characters. Happy Halloween and…’SHAZAM’!

00:00-21:54: Intro/Black Adam/DCEU

21:55-36:38: Clerks III

36:39-55:21: Physical Media Picks

55:22-1:06:08: Wolfen

1:06:09-1:18:23: 5 Favorite View Askew Universe Characters

1:18:24-1:19:28: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 628: Halloween Ends, Blonde, Company Of Wolves, 5 Favorite Halloween Candies
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt head back to Haddonfield one more time, for now, as the David Gordon Green and Danny McBride helmed Halloween rest comes to an end with, ‘Halloween Ends’.  Is Jamie Lee Curtis’ second run at franchise resetting sequel the best one yet?  Then it’s on to the film Matt has been chomping at the bit to discuss for weeks!  Andrew Dominik’s ‘Blonde’, featuring Ana De Armas as the Marilyn Monroe.  It’s Netflix’s first NC-17 film, could it herald the beginning of a re-examination of the rating and its stigma? But things don’t end there! The Werewolf Marathon continues with ‘The Company Of Wolves’, a Grimm’s Fairy Tale come to life ala Hammer Studios. But was the 80’s too late to release it?  There’s the venerable rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Halloween Candies! What are you hoping to score this season?

00:00-18:50: Intro/Haloween Ends

18:50-33:50: Blonde

33:51-43:20: Physical Media Picks

43:21-55:44: The Company of Wolves

55:45-1:09:24: 5 Favorite Halloween Candies

1:09:25-1:11:45: Wrap-Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 627: Amsterdam, Hellraiser, Ginger Snaps, 5 Favorite 80’s Horror Monsters
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt dive in to the A-Lister stuffed latest from David O. Russell, ‘Amsterdam’. Then we open the LeMarchand box and experience the ickiest of dubious pleasures with Hulu’s ‘Hellraiser’ remake/reboot. But wait there’s more! Our spooky season werewolf marathon continues with ‘Ginger Snaps’, a film that sets out to prove there is truly nothing so terrifying as a teenage girl. There’s the life-changing rundown of the big releases on physical media, featuring the Streaming and DVD Picks of the Week. Then Matt and Chris wrap it all up with their 5 Favorite Movie Monsters of the 80’s. So light ‘em if you got and join us down to the red-light district for another episode of The First Run!

00:00-17:34: Intro/Amsterdam

17:35-31:02: Hellraiser (22)

31:03-41:57: Physical Media Picks

41:58-51:22: Ginger Snaps

51:23-1:02:14: 5 Favorite 80’s Movie Monsters

1:02:15-1:04:57: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 626: Smile, The Wolf Man, 5 Streaming Horror Picks
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt decide to deal with our personal trauma head on, via confronting an evil entity that represents said trauma. It’s been the chic thing to do in horror the past few years, but can it be too on the nose, or down the mouth if you will. It’s ‘Smile’’.  Then our Halloween Werewolves Movie Marathon begins with the OG Universal classic, 1941’s ‘The Wolf Man’. Lon Chaney Jr. is the titular Wolfman, named Larry. Not something cool like Sirius or Dixon. Fenris? Nope it’s Larry the sexual predator Wolfman. How does the old boy hold up after all these years? There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week. Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing some Horror Picks for you to stream this haunted season.

00:00-12:09: Intro/Smile

12:10-31:34: Physical Media Picks/Darkplace

31:35-43:35: The Wolfman (1941)

43:36-1:03:56: 5 Streaming Horror Picks

1:03:57-1:08:46: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 625: Don’t Worry Darling, Confess, Fletch, 5 Favorite Alternate Realities
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt publicly serve Olivia Wilde with another review of her latest, ‘Don't Worry Darling’. Is it as bad as critics make out to be or is Harry Styles so miscast that not even Florence Pugh and Chris Pine can save it?  Then, we'll open the 80's nostalgia time capsule and pull out a sequel I don't think anyone was asking for with ‘Confess, Fletch’. This one replaces Chevy Chase with Jon Hamm though so it can go nowhere but up, right?  Right?  As always, we'll run down the upcoming major releases on physical media, our Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Matt and Chris then finalize the latest notch on their podcast bed frame with our Top 5 Alternate Reality/Parallel Universes films.  I realize now that even saying that may be a spoiler for one of the films. Oops! Anyway...let's take a listen to Don't Worry Darling while I fire another intern.

00:00-11:36: Intro/Don’t Worry Darling

11:37-29:12: Physical Media & Darkplace

29:13-42:36: Confess, Fletch

42:37-57:02: 5 Favorite Alternate Realities

57:03-1:00:02: Wrap Up 

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 624: Pearl, Moonage Daydream, 5 Favorite Albums
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt venture back to war time, World War I to be specific, and check in on everyone’s favorite super horny geriatric maniac in her young, formative years.  Ti West and Mia Goth return with ‘Pearl’!  Can a prequel possibly improve upon, or rescue, ‘X’?  Then Matt throws Chris a bone as they discuss the David Bowie Super Documentary, ‘Moonage Daydream’.  Bowie being Chris’ favorite musician, he tends to run super-critical of works associated with The Thin White Duke.  How does this “documentary” turn out.  And why is Chris using “Quotes”?  There’s the life-affirming rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week!  Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Albums.  How many Bowie albums will be on Chris’ list?  Will The Return Of Bruno show up?  Will Foreigner Make Matt’s list?  Why does Matt hate Foreigner? And by extension, why does Matt hate Chris? 

00:00-13:00: Intro/Pearl

13:01-29:20: Physical Media Picks/Darkplace

29:21-42:53: Moonage Daydream

42:54-1:17:21: Top 5 Favorite Albums [Currently]

1:17:22-1:18:20: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Scalzo’s Frank Black & The Catholics Mix

This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt venture back to war time, World War I to be specific, and check in on everyone’s favorite super horny geriatric maniac in her young, formative years. Ti West and Mia Goth return with ‘Pearl’! Can a prequel possibly improve upon, or rescue, ‘X’? Then Matt throws Chris a bone as they discuss the David Bowie Super Documentary, ‘Moonage Daydream’. Bowie being Chris’ favorite musician, he tends to run super-critical of works associated with The Thin White Duke. How does this “documentary” turn out. And why is Chris using “Quotes”? There’s the life-affirming rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week! Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Albums. How many Bowie albums will be on Chris’ list? Will The Return Of Bruno show up? Will Foreigner Make Matt’s list? Why does Matt hate Foreigner? And by extension, why does Matt hate Chris?
00:00-13:00: Intro/Pearl 13:01-29:20: Physical Media Picks/Darkplace 29:21-42:53: Moonage Daydream 42:54-1:17:21: Top 5 Favorite Albums [Currently] 1:17:22-1:18:20: Wrap Up
Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 623: Barbarian, Pinocchio, 5 Favorite Disney Characters
item.description:
This week on the First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest indie horror darling, ‘Barbarian’.  Is it a Gen Z, ultra-meta Air BnB critique that’s too clever for its own good?  Or is it a surprisingly effective gem?  Your favorite internet uncles will fill you in. Then it’s on to the latest entry in the Tom Hanks does a bad accent canon, the “live-action” Pinocchio. As always, we’ll run down the upcoming releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then wrap up the show by sharing their Top 5 Disney (not Pixar) Characters. It’s gonna’ be a humdinger folks. So book those reservations, make sure your flashlight has fresh batteries, and hope for the best!

13:22-28:45: Physical Media & Darkplace

28:46-38:36: Pinocchio (Zemeckis)

38:37-51:38: 5 Favorite Disney Characters

51:39-53:44: Wrap Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 622: Honk For Jesus. Save Your Soul., Resurrection, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt share with you a kindness with their discussion of Adamma Ebo’s ‘Honk For Jesus. Save Your Soul’. The dark satire about a mega-church’s fall from grace and attempted comeback featuring Regina Hall and Sterling K. Brown.  Redemption is guaranteed, right? Then Rebecca Hall and Tim Roth star in a riveting thriller,  ‘Resurrection’. A film that takes a turn that may or may not work. Hall has been on quite a streak, does it continue? There’s the transcendent rundown of the big releases on physical media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close the show with another round of everyone’s favorite fill in the blank game, ‘TFR Libs’!  Featuring Indiana Jones, Hellraiser, and more!

14:53-28:18 Physical Media, Weekly Picks and Darkplace!

28:19-40:50 Resurrection

40:51-1:02 TFR Libs

1:02-1:04 Wrap-Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 621: Three Thousand Years Of Longing, Voyage Of Time, Malick Marathon Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with another movie Matt has never heard of with George Miller’s (yes, that George Miller) ‘Three Thousand Years of Longing’. Tilda Swinton plays a scholar that specializes in storytelling, of legend and myth. She finds a bottle and releases an honest to goodness Jinn, played by the overly handsome DJ Idris Elba. So what wishes will be granted? And what stories will be told? Then it’s time to wrap up the Malick Marathon with both versions of “documentary”, ‘Voyage of Time’. Malick’s telling of the birth and end of the universe with two distinct versions, one narrated by Cate Blanchette and the other by Brad Pitt. There’s the loving rundown of the big physical media releases for the week and the guys share the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Finally, Matt and Chris award their personal “best ofs” from the Malick Marathon.

00:00-11:16: Intro/Three Thousand Years Of Longing

11:17-22:57: Physical Media Picks & Darkplace(?)

23:58-33:22: Voyage Of Time

33:23-42:59: Malick Marathon Awards

43:00-44:41: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 620: Orphan: First Kill, Knight Of The Cups, Call It!
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the return of everyone’s favorite Esther, it’s ‘Orphan: First Kill’. In this prequel to the cult classic, they take a BIG swing, but does it connect? For the hit.  It’s a baseball metaphor.  Then our Malick Marathon continues with its penultimate entry, ‘Night Of The Cups’. Christian Bale stars as a lost man in search of himself. As there is apparently raging hurricanes around him at all times as Malick’s camera is never stationary. There’s the life-bringing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week, plus Chris checks in on whether Matt watched that first episode of ‘Garth Marenghi’s Dark Place’. Finally, Matt and Chris close out the show with another round of Call It!  What’s making the cut this time…?

00:00-14:20: Intro/Orphan: First Kill

14:21-30:02: Physical Media & Darkplace

30:03-42:50: Knight Of The Cups

42:51-1:00:01: Call It!

1:00:02-1:01:37: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 619: Bodies Bodies Bodies, Bullet Train, The New World, 5 Favorite Brad Pitt Performances
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with the latest offering from A24, the post-post-modern murder satire ‘Bodies Bodies Bodies’. Someone turns up dead during a friendly game, but who dun it? And does it even matter?  From there it’s on to the Brad Pitt led latest over-saturated action cameo-fest, ‘Bullet Train’. So many stars! So much potential!  So much movie!  Then Matt and Chris crest the top of the bell curve with our third entry in our Malick Marathon, ‘The New World’. Breathtaking visuals, quiet, contemplatively shots, featuring an expansive story about the birth of America, through the lens of one relationship.  There’s the cosmic rundown of the big Physical Media Releases, along with the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week! The supersized episode then closes with Chris and Matt’s favorite Brad Pitt performances, which I assume is just a supercut of Pitt in ‘Thelma & Louise’.

00:00-14:42: Intro/Bodies, Bodies, Bodies

14:43-24:26: Bullet Train

24:27-39:01: Physical Media Releases

39:02-54:36: The New World

54:37-1:08:17: 5 Favorite Brad Pitt Performances

1:08:18-1:10:16: Warp Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 618: Prey, The Thin Red Line, 5 Sequel Scenarios
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt head deep into the frontier as we discuss the latest Predator sequel, ‘Prey’. In this entry, a budding Comanche warrior goes up against one of the fiercest hunters in the universe. Can she take it down? And how much Mary Sue BS does the internet stir up this time? Then our Malick Marathon continues with ‘The Thin Red Line’. Malick’s fictional story during the Guadalcanal Campaign in World War II. So how does it stack up against some of the more well-known war films like ‘Apocalypse Now’, ‘Platoon’, ‘Saving Private Ryan’…? There’s the crowd rousing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show by coming up with their 5 Sequel Scenario Ideas! Where should a Predator pop up next? When would you put Pinhead?

00:00-19:02: Intro/Prey

19:03-32:56: Physical Media Picks

32:57-43:40: The Thin Red Line

43:41-56:02: 5 Sequel Scenarios

56:03-57:38: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 617: Marcel The Shell With Shoes On, Days Of Heaven, The Lounge
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt check out the first animated feature for A24, it’s ‘Marcel The Shell With Shoes On’. Jenny Slate and Dean Fleischer-Camp bring their wildly popular shorts to the big screen in a heartwarming tale that hits all the buttons. Perhaps unremarkably so?  Then Matt and Chris get their visual poetry on with ‘Days of Heaven’, the first entry in their Terrence Malick Marathon. There’s the electrifying rundown of the big Physical Media Releases, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Then the guys wrap up the show by slowing it down for another hip and happening entry of ‘The Lounge’ featuring a breakdown of all the MCU announcements at the San Diego ComicCon. Note: The Warner Bros/Discovery discussion took place just as the Scoob sequel and Batgirl cancellations were announced.  All the other recent shenanigans hadn’t broken yet. So put on some smooth jazz, kick back, and take it easy my friend.  It’s another chill episode of The First Run.

00:00-09:24: Intro/Marcel The Shell With Shoes On

09:25-18:41: Physical Media Picks

18:42-29:41: Days of Heaven

29:42-59:28: The Lounge

59:29-1:01:23: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 616: Nope, Innocents, Master, 5 Favorite Scary Movie Kids
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Jordan Peele’s third film, his third number one debut, and the most successful original IP film of the year, ‘Nope’.  After the smash success of ‘Get Out’ and the thrilling, but not quite as good ‘Us’, Peele returns with his take on the alien horror, comedy, social commentary, western, sci-fi, mystery, family drama genre.  Then they guys pick up the slack left my Chris’ illness last week and discuss the Norwegian killer kids thriller, ‘The Innocents’. And the speaking of social commentary, there’s Regina Hall’s ‘Master’.  There’s the death-defying rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Scary Kids. In a movie.

00:00-20:24: Intro/Nope

20:25-30:24: The Innocents

30:25-40:35: Physical Media Picks

40:36-49:52: Master

49:53-1:03:41: 5 Favorite Scary Movie Kids

1:03:42-1:06:13: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Focus Ep. 24: ScreenRun: Aliens
item.description: This week on The First Run, Chris is recovering from a particularly nasty bug that prevented him from venturing out to the theaters and has affected his voice. He wants his ravings to be at the crystal clear quality you've come to expect so there is no new episode for this week. But fear not, most loyal listener. Your podcast BFFs are not going to leave you high and dry. For your listening pleasure, we have a special episode of Chris' other show, ScreenRun. ScreenRun is a film podcast where Chris and the podcast mommy herself, the Lady Wan, run through the filmography of a particular director, actor or movie franchise per season. It's really quite good, you should like and subscribe. In the show's second season, Chris and Wan ran through the Alien series and we've queued up for you the episode for what some would correctly call the best film in the franchise with James Cameron's 1986 sequel, Aliens. If you're saying to yourself "Matt...you're my favorite...I tune in for you!" I would say that you have excellent taste and to fear not since they were gracious enough to invite me as a guest on this episode. Thank you for your understanding and rest assured, your favorite internet uncles will be back next week to discuss the Norwegian supernatural thriller The Innocents, the psychological horror film Master, and Jordan Peele's much anticipated third film, Nope. So sit back, relax, and enjoy this special presentation of Screen Run.

item.title: TFR Ep. 615: Thor: Love And Thunder, Spiderhead, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt check in on what’s been going on in the ol’ MCU as Phase 4 continues with ‘Thor: Love And Thunder’.  Taika Waititi’s ‘Thor: Ragnarok’ is a favorite around these parts and we were anxious to see what was next. Then, HemsFest continues with Joseph Kosinski’s (of Top Gun Maverick fame) reunites with Miles Teller for the paranoia thriller, ‘Spiderhead’.  What experiments would you perform if provided an ample number of inmates in secluded area?  There’s the ravenous review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with your favorite fill-in-the-blank game, ‘TFR Libs’.  Is Marvel fatigue a thing? 3+ years before a new Bond film? Clerks 3?!? And more!

00:00-19:05: Intro/Thor: Love And Thunder

19:06-33:41: Physical Media Picks

33:42-42:40: Spiderhead

42:41-1:04:41: TFR Libs

1:04:42-1:06:17: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 614: Hustle, You Won't Be Alone, 5 Favorite Dramatic Turns By Comedians
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt lace up their Chuck Taylors and head down to the court to shoot some hoops as Adam Sandler returns in the Netflix original, ‘Hustle’. The sports movie is a tried and true genre, but is there enough there to make for compelling viewing? Or is it a clichéd exercise?  Then it’s on to the horror import, ‘You Won’t Be Alone’, that takes a more humanist turn with the witch ethos. But does it sacrifice the terror too?  There’s the shriek inducing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then wrap up the big show by sharing their 5 Favorite Dramatic Turns By Comedians.  Is this how Matt becomes Joker?  Listen on, if you dare!

00:00-09:30: Hustle

09:31-16:57: Physical Media Picks

16:58-26:58: You Won’t Be Alone

26:59-42:34: 5 Favorite Dramatic Turns By Comedians

42:35-43:47: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 613: The Black Phone, Mad God, What Are The Odds?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt get their spooky time on with the latest from Blumhouse, ‘The Black Phone’. Is it the best horror movie in ages or is that more hyperbole from the desperate fan base of a genre with the lowest bar for entry and yet the highest bar for quality? Your know-it-all internet uncles are here to make the definitive call. Then they dive into the lemarchand box of stop motion animation, Phil Tippett’s ‘Mad God’, one man’s passion project 30 years in the making with a history that seems like it was cribbed from a creepy pasta. Was it worth it? Does it make sense? Have your hosts stared into the void and saw the void stare back? You’ll find out soon enough! They’ll have our rundown of the new releases on physical media, your Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.Then Matt and Chris wrap it up with the bookie approved probability game, What Are The Odds? So Let’s get this further descent into despair and madness started with a clip from the Black Phone.

00:00-11:06: Intro/The Black Phone

11:07-20:27: Physical Media Picks

20:28-30:12: Mad God

30:13-52:51: What Are The Odds?!?

52:52-54:19: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 612: Lightyear, Cha Cha Real Smooth, The Thing 40th Anniversary Screening, 5 Favorite Pixar Characters
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discus the latest content from Disney, it’s ‘Lightyear’, the movie Andy saw that inspired his love for the Buzz Lightyear character and toys! Is it a fitting sorta’ origin for Buzz? And where is poor, poor Tim Allen? Then it’s time for the guys to grow up one more time with the latest coming-of-age film, ‘Cha Chan Real Smooth’. This time, a young man is adrift after college and falls for an older woman with her own personal challenges. And heartfelt hilarity follows from there. As it always does…? Chris and Matt have a quick discussion on Fathom’s “presentation” of The Thing” to celebrate its 40th Anniversary.  There’s the interstellar review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight To DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week! Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Pixar Characters? I wouldn’t hold out hope for a Lightning McQueen appearance. Vroom Vroom! It’s The First Run!

00:00-13:35: Intro/Lightyear

13:36-19:57: 40th Anniversary Screening of The Thing

19:58-35:35: Physical Media Picks

35:36-46:44: Cha Cha Real Smooth

46:45-55:41: 5 Favorite Pixar Characters

55:42-57:20: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 611: Jurassic World: Dominion, RRR, Who Dat?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt take one last ride around the park with ‘Jurassic World: Dominion’.  Is this a fitting send off or proof that this franchise should have remained extinct?  Then it’s on to discuss ‘Rise Roar Revolt’ or ‘RRR’, the Tollywood action film that was a smash hit in India and is taking the rest of the world by storm. Are we going to have another example of Chris gushing over the new hotness du jour with Matt not seeing what the big deal is or vice versa? Will our hosts do what they usually do and agree? Listen on to find out!  There’s the suspenseful rundown of the big Physical Media Picks of the Week, featuring straight to dvd and streaming picks of the week then we’ll wrap up the show with everyone’s reference to the 2010 New Orleans Saints, Who Dat?!?  Featuring appearances by Greta Gerwig, Todd Phillips, Matt Reeves, and more!

00:00-24:39: Intro/Jurassic World: Dominion

24:40-38:37: Physical Media Picks

38:38-56:04: RRR

56:05-1:15:12: Who Dat?!?

1:15:13-1:16:26: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 610: Crimes Of The Future, Watcher, 5 Favorite Cronenberg Scenes
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Cronenberg’s return to gross, icky, body horror sex stuff with ‘Crimes Of The Future’.  After a run of critically acclaimed thrillers, a shift into smaller, odder films, Daddy Cronenberg is back, but does he still got it?  And it meaning Ewww and Ohhhh…  Then it’s another theatrical release, IFC Midnight and Shudder presents ‘Watcher’, featuring Maika (‘It Follows’) Monroe. Does director Chloe Okuno breathe new life into the genre?  There’s the edge-of-your seat rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with their 5 Favorite Most Unsettling Cronenberg Scenes.

00:00-15:23: Intro/Crimes Of The Future

15:24-32:06: Physical Media Picks

32:07-39:39: Watcher

39:40-55:44: 5 Favorite Cronenberg Scenes

55:45-57:43: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 609: Top Gun: Maverick, The Sadness, 5 Favorite Childhood Crushes
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt break out the aviators and cue up the Kenny Loggins for the sequel to that Tom Cruise volleyball movie, ‘Top Gun: Maverick’. 35+ years later, is the magic still there, or was the original such an artifact of its time that the past should have been left well enough alone.  Then it’s on to Taiwan for the extreme horror riff on The Crazies, ‘The Sadness’.  Described as “The most violent and depraved zombie movie of all time”, can it possibly live up to the hype?  As always, there’s the breakdown of the big Physical Media releases and the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris wrap up the show with their Top 5 Childhood Pop Culture Crushes…man that’s a mouthful.

00:00-24:49: Intro/Top Gun: Maverick

24:50-41:16: Physical Media Picks

41:17-52:05: The Sadness

52:06-1:06:43: 5 Favorite Childhood Crushes

1:06:44-1:08:18: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 608: Men, Jiu-Jitsu, CageFest Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt get into a philosophical discussion about Men.  Specifically Alex Garland’s latest, ‘Men’. #NotAllMen, but maybe #MostMen?  After the successes of ‘Ex Machina’ and ‘Annihilation’ (and the rumored ghost directing of ‘Dredd’), Garland returns with a horror film about toxic bro’s, bro. And so much more.  Too much more?  Then CageFest wraps with ‘Jiu-Jitsu’ featuring a bunch of people picking up some extra shifts and a drop-in by the man himself.  There’s the stylin’ rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show with the traditional marathon awards ceremony. Time to break down the best and worst of CageFest! 

00:00-13:19: Intro/Men

13:20-27:24: Physical Media Picks

27:25-41:27: CageFest: Jiu-Jitsu

41:28-49:23: CageFest Awards

49:24-53:32: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 607: Firestarter, Vengeance: A Love Story, 5 Favorite Stephen King Scares
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest Stephen King adaptation, scratch that, the latest adaptation remake. The film sparking our interest this time is ‘Firestarter’.  We’ve long been supporters of remaking bad films, and John Lester’s original is far from a classic.  So does ‘Firestarter’ light us up?  Then CageFest continues with ‘Vengeance: A Love Story’.  Nic Cage is a cop on the edge, who crosses the line when of punks get off.  Sounds awesome. So is it?  There’s the rambunctious rundown of the big releases Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week!  Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Stephen King Movie Scares!  Haunted cars, rabid dogs, and demonic clowns. Will The Dark Tower make the list?  More like Dork Tower.  It's The First Run!

00:00-13:41: Intro/Firestarter

13:42-16:39: Happening

16:40-32:41: Physical Media Picks

32:42-43:48: CageFest: Vengeance: A Love Story

43:49-56:16: 5 Favorite Stephen King Scares

56:17-58:29: Wrap Up 

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 606: Doctor Strange In The Multiverse Of Madness, Kill Chain, 5 Favorite MCU Post Credit Scenes
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest entry to the MCU and Sam Raimi’s directorial return to comic book movies, ‘Dr Strange In The Multiverse Of Madness’. Do we have another event MCU film with the Fox characters (X-Men, Fantastic Four, etc.) make their big debuts? Plus Chris shares his thoughts on the latest AMC Feature Drink, ‘The Sorcerer’. Then, CageFest continues with the I’m-not-sure-what-it-is-supposed-to-be ‘Kill Chain’, a Nic Cage movie that has a rather large dearth of Nic Cage. As always, there’s the breakdown the Physical Media releases, featuring the Straight To DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Then Matt and Chris wrap up the show with their 5 Favorite Marvel Post Credit Sequences. Holy crap, you are excited! So cast yourself a spell or two and settle in for another episode!

19:45-21:58: AMC The Sorcerer Adult Beverage

item.title: TFR Ep. 605: Hatching, Cage Fest: Army Of One, Call It!
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the Finnish horror film, ‘Hatching’. A film that is at once unimaginable and at the same time deceptively simple.  Then Cage-Fest continues with Matt “Ripping His Shirt” and I discussing the Larry Charles helmed comedy, that’s right, the Borat director’s ‘Army Of One’ has Cage on a mission to bring in Osama Bin Laden, alive!  There’s the stupefyingly beautiful rundown of the big releases featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris wrap up the big show with another round of ‘Call It!’, featuring Audrey Hepburn, Jesus, Hanshiro Tsugumo, and more! So grab your swords and delicately pack your eggs.  It’s another wild trip down the road of cinema! Yay! 

00:00-13:51: Intro/Hatching

13:52-24:51: Physical Media Releases

24:52-35:27: CageFest: Army Of One

35:28-52:36: Call It!

52:37-54:46: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 604: The Northman, The Unbearable Weight Of Massive Talent, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on the First Run, Chris and Matt go on a raid with Robert Eggers’ highly anticipated Viking revenge Hamlet (but not really) homage ‘The Northman’. After finding success with ‘The Witch’ and ‘The Lighthouse’, can Eggers’ streak of great films that begin with indefinite articles continue? Then we kick off our CageFest marathon with the meta action comedy, ‘Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent’. With the critical acclaim for his last project, ‘Pig’, does Cage capture the magic again?  We’ll give a breakdown of this week’s Physical Media releases and as well as the Straight-To-DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Matt and Chriss then wrap up the show with their patented fill in the blank game, TFR Libs. This week featuring The Expendable, The Batman, and more! So grab you axe, show up at a birthday party for a gun-runner and let’s get ready to party!

00:00-13:09: Intro/The Northman

13:10-22:14: Physical Media Picks

22:15-35:11: The Unbearable Weight Of Massive Talent

35:12-52:16: TFR Libs

52:17-54:03: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Twitter

Instagram

Facebook

item.title: TFR Ep. 603: Secrets Of Dumbledore, Choose Or Die, 5 Great Movies Associated With Horrible People
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest (and lastest?) in the Fantastic Beasts series, ‘The Secrets Of Dumbledore’.  The Harry Potter expansion returns with Eddie Redmayne, who should have lost that Best Actor statue to Michael Keaton, Dan Fogler, Jude Law, and Mads Mikkleson taking over for Johnny Depp. Can the series redeem itself from its droll cash grab roots?  Then it’s on to the Netflix original ‘Choose Or Die’ as a couple of crazy kids find an old video game with a terrifying interactive feature.  Chris sure does love his 80’s homages, but is that enough?  There’s the gut-wrenching rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week. Chris has some corrections and stumbled across a potential massive scandal. Finally Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Movie Projects Associated With Horrible People.  Woody Allen? Bill Cosby? Roman Polanski?  Sounds like fun…

item.content:encoded:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest (and lastest?) in the Fantastic Beasts series, ‘The Secrets Of Dumbledore’.  The Harry Potter expansion returns with Eddie Redmayne, who should have lost that Best Actor statue to Michael Keaton, Dan Fogler, Jude Law, and Mads Mikkleson taking over for Johnny Depp. Can the series redeem itself from its droll cash grab roots?  Then it’s on to the Netflix original ‘Choose Or Die’ as a couple of crazy kids find an old video game with a terrifying interactive feature.  Chris sure does love his 80’s homages, but is that enough?  There’s the gut-wrenching rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week. Chris has some corrections and stumbled across a potential massive scandal. Finally Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Movie Projects Associated With Horrible People.  Woody Allen? Bill Cosby? Roman Polanski?  Sounds like fun…

item.title: TFR Ep. 602: Everything Everywhere All At Once, Jacaranda Joe, AmbuLAance, Who Dat?!?
item.description:
This week on the First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with yet another multiverse film in the Daniels’ ‘Everything, Everywhere All At Once’ with Michelle Yeoh. We also get into some Bay-hem with ‘Ambulance’, featuring Jake Gyllenhaal and Yahya Abdul-Mateen II. Can there be too much Everything-Go-Boom?  There’s the discussion of the big physical media releases, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Then we’ll wrap up the show with everyone’s favorite role play game, Who Dat?!? featuring appearances by Johnny Hollywood, other big time CEO’s, and Christopher Lloyd. All that and more on this week’s program!

item.title: TFR Ep. 601: Morbius, The Bubble, Fresh, What Are The Odds?!?
item.description:
This week on a special 601st anniversary episode of The First Run, initially things looked pretty bleak for your intrepid hosts. Not only do Matt and Chris discuss the latest Marvel side piece, ‘Morbius’, Chris messed up and watched ‘The Bubble’, forgetting that we all agreed last week to watch ‘Fresh’.  So what did we do? We watched all three. Plus Chris debuts a new feature! So was the week redeemed?  There’s the life-affirming review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week!  Then Matt and Chris leave the Top 5’s behind, at least for this week, with the return of everyone’s favorite Vegas style segment, ‘What Are The Odds’, featuring Sony, Netflix, and more!  So grab your garlic necklaces, be sure to tenderize your meat, and quarantine yourself with a few pals for this episode of The First Run!

00:00-18:38: Intro/Morbius

18:39-29:47: The Bubble

29:48-38:11: Physical Media Picks

38:12-49:14: Fresh

49:15-1:04:43: What Are The Odds?!?

item.title: TFR Ep. 600: The Lost City, CODA, TFR Top 50: 10-1
item.description:
This week on a special 600th episode of The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the return of the romantic adventure genre featuring Sandra Bullock and Channing Tatum in ‘The Lost City’.  A historical romance writer is kidnapped as she may know certain clues to a lost treasure.  Is it a genre primed for a comeback? And how is the chemistry between Bullock and Tatum? Then it’s on to this year’s Best Picture winner, ‘CODA’.  The story of a hearing young woman who is the “Child Of Deaf Adults” who is desperate to leave her small town behind and pursue an education in music. But she’s torn by the love of her family and their dependance on her.  Best Picture, huh?  There’s the heartwarming review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then wrap up the show and the Countdown of their 50 Favorite Films with movies 10-1.

00:00-13:17: Intro/The Lost City

13:18-24:20: Physical Media Picks

24:21-36:15: CODA

36:16-43:24: 2022 Oscars Recap

43:25-1:08:23: TFR Top 50: 10-1

1:08:24-1:10:56: Wrap Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 599: X, Deep Water, TFR Top 50: 20-11
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest from Ti West, ‘X’.  After the fantastic ‘House Of The Devil’, the underwhelming ‘The Innkeepers’, and the solid ‘The Sacrament’, West returns with his loving tribute to 70’s slashers.  The kids seem to love it, but is it scary?  Then the psychological super-hot sexy thriller featuring super sexy Ben Affleck and super-duper sexy Ana De Armas.  And what does J-Lo think of all this?  I bet you Ben’s in some ‘Deep Water’…There’s the thrilling review of thebig releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week!  Matt and Chris then close the show with their anniversary countdown of the 50 Favorite Films.  This time out, it’s 20-11.  So close!

00:00-14:47: Intro/X

14:48-26:37: Physical Media Picks

26:38-40:37: Deep Water (& Veganism?!?)

40:38-1:08:57: TFR Top 50: 20-11

item.title: TFR Ep. 598: The Adam Project, Belfast, TFR Top 50: 30-21
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest Ryan Reynolds / Shaw Levy team up, ‘The Adam Project’.  After the success of ‘Free Guy’, the two return for a sci-fi actioner for Netflix featuring Reynolds’ unending, some say unbearable, charm, drama, romance, and thrills! But does it end the drought of the star’s lack luster Netflix produced content?  Then it’s on the Kenneth Branaugh’s Best Picture contender, ‘Belfast’.  The family drama set during the clashes in the Irish town as Jamie Dornan and his family struggle to survive and do what’s right.  There’s the luxurious rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show then closes as Matt and Chris continue the Countdown of their 50 Favorite Films as we inch closer to episode 600.  This week, it’s films 30-21!

12:49-22:28: Physical Media Picks

22:29-30:57: Belfast

item.title: TFR Ep. 597: The Batman, Red Rocket, TFR Top 50: 40-31
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Matt Reeves’ entry in the Batman movie franchise, ‘The Batman’. Robert Pattinson dons the cowl and begins a new era for the caped crusader.  But is it a good era?  Then it’s on to Sean Baker’s latest slice of underbelly Americana with ‘Red Rocket’.  Simon Rex won the Best Male Lead at the Independent Spirit Awards for his performance.  But how’s the film itself?  There’s the ever-adorable rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with the continuation of their Top 50 Favorite Films.  This week, it’s 40-31!

item.title: TFR Ep. 596: Studio 666, Dog, Old Henry, TFR Top 50: 50-41
item.description:
This week on The First Run, the countdown to episode 600 begins! Chris and Matt discuss the horror-comedy ‘Studio 666’, featuring, and inspired by, the Foo Fighters. Yep.  Is it this generation’s ‘Spinal Tap’/Exorcist’ mash up somebody was looking for?  A complete disaster?  A cult classic in the making?  So much much.  Chris shares his thoughts on Channing Tatum’s ‘Dog’. Is it a heartwarming family drama or is there something else going on? Then we shift to a genre Matt actually likes, the western.  Tim Blake Nelson stars in ‘Old Henry’, about a farmer with a secret past where truths are revealed as he and his family are beset by roaming marauders.  There’s the thrilling rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show by revealing the first part of our Top 50 Countdown of their favorite films.

 

00:00-16:04: Intro/Studio 666

16:05-27:23: Physical Media Picks

27:24-30:50: Dog

30:51-38:55: Old Henry

item.content:encoded:
This week on The First Run, the countdown to episode 600 begins! Chris and Matt discuss the horror-comedy ‘Studio 666’, featuring, and inspired by, the Foo Fighters. Yep.  Is it this generation’s ‘Spinal Tap’/Exorcist’ mash up somebody was looking for?  A complete disaster?  A cult classic in the making?  So much much.  Chris shares his thoughts on Channing Tatum’s ‘Dog’. Is it a heartwarming family drama or is there something else going on? Then we shift to a genre Matt actually likes, the western.  Tim Blake Nelson stars in ‘Old Henry’, about a farmer with a secret past where truths are revealed as he and his family are beset by roaming marauders.  There’s the thrilling rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show by revealing the first part of our Top 50 Countdown of their favorite films.

 

00:00-16:04: Intro/Studio 666

item.title: TFR Ep. 595: Uncharted, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, 5 Films That Could Use A Legacy Sequel
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt venture out to parts unknown on their search for that ever-elusive cinematic treasure, the good video game adaptation with ‘Uncharted’.  Tom Holland steps into the role of Nathan Drake, the lead character from the acclaimed video game series.  Have we found the gold?  Then it’s on to scenic Texas by way of Bulgaria for the latest legacy sequel, ‘Texas Chainsaw Massacre’, minus the indefinite article.  Elsie Fischer (Yes, Elsie Fischer of ‘Eighth Grade’) and pals decide to revitalize a ghost town, but one inhabitant isn’t too keen on gentrification. There’s the endearing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the ceremonies by sharing their 5 Favorite Films That Could Use A Legacy Sequel.  Though maybe that answer should be ‘None’.

00:00-13:40: Intro/Uncharted

13:41-23:14: Physical Media Picks

23:15-38:27: Texas Chainsaw Massacre

38:28-57:52: 5 Legacy Sequel Ideas

57:53-59:32: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 594: Blacklight, Kimi, 5 Favorite Soderbergh Scenes
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Liam Neeson doing Liam Neeson things in ‘Blacklight’.  Has the shine on the King of January & February Cinema’s crown started to dull?  Then it’s on to the latest from Mr. Steven Soderbergh, it’s ‘Kimi’, featuring Zoë Kravitz in a Rear Window-esque thriller for the electronic assistant age. There’s the rejuvenating rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the big show by sharing their 5 Favorite Soderbergh Scenes!

item.title: TFR Ep. 593: Moonfall, House Of Gucci, 10 Favorite Films of 2021: 5-1
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris Scalzo and Matt ‘Razzlekhan’ Howell discuss the latest disaster epic from Roland Emmerich, ‘Moonfall’.  This time it’s up to Halle Berry, Patrick Wilson, Samwell himself, John Bradley to save the world from the moon crashing into the Earth.  Oh, and there are some aliens and an AI gone mad. And a bunch of other stuff.  Then it’s on to Ridley Scott’s second film of 2021, ‘House Of Gucci’, featuring Lady Gaga, Adam Driver, and more.  And Jared Leto.  There’s the incendiary rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week. Matt and Chris then close out the show with the wrap up of their 10 Favorite Films of 2021, Films 5-1.  Barb and Star still have time to make the cut…

13:57-27:15: Physical Media Picks

27:16-37:43: House Of Gucci

37:44-57:11: 10 Favorite Films of 2021: 5-1

57:12-58:31: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 592: Parallel Mothers, Flee, 10 Favorite Films of 2021: 10-6
item.description:
Lots of subtitles this time. This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest Pedro Almodóvar and Penelope Cruz team up, ‘Parallel Mothers’. Cruz plays a single mother trying to balance her career, life, and a terrible secret. Speaking of secrets, I was certain Matt “Once Bitten, Twice Shy” Howell was going to watch the Lawrence Fishburne, Stephen Baldwin classic ‘Fled’ instead, but thankfully here we are. It’s the Danish animated documentary tearing up the charts, ‘Flee’.  A tale of survival and secrets from a child refugee of war-torn Afghanistan.  To lighten things up, we’ll review the big releases on Physical Media featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with the first part of our 10 Favorite Films of 2021, Films 10-6.  What’s making the cut? Listen on to find out. 

00:00-11:45: Intro/Parallel Mothers

11:46-26:18: Physical Media Picks

26:19-38:10: Flee

38:11-54:20: 10 Favorite Films of 2021: 10-6

54:21-55:17: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 591: Drive My Car, Dual, Something In The Dirt, 5 Favorite Doppelgänger Films
item.description:
This week on The First Run, does Matt finally quite the show after I make him watch a Japanese drama about a guy getting chauffeured around for 3 hours?  That’s right, it’s the highly regarding Best International Feature front runner from Japan, ‘Drive My Car’.  Heartache, grief, plays, and road trips!  Sounds like a blast.  Then Matt and Chris dip their toe in the 2022 Sundance Film Festival pool with Riley Stearns’ ‘Dual’ and Justin Benson & Aaron Moorhead’s ‘Something In The Dirt’.  There’s the remarkable rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show then closes as Chris and Matt share their 5 Favorite Doppelgänger Films, featuring the tethered, snatched bodies, and some good old-fashioned obsession.

00:00-13:16: Intro/Drive My Car

13:17-22:35: Physical Media Picks

22:36-31:37: Dual

31:38-33:59: Something In The Dirt

34:00-51:15: 5 Favorite Doppelgänger Films

51:16-53:15: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 590: Scream, The Worst Person In The World, 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the potential revitalization of one of the most popular horror franchises of the 90’s and aughts.  It’s Scream!  What’s with the re-using of original titles lately? TCM, Halloween, now Scream?  Weird.  So How have Sidney, Gale, and Dewey been?  What’s up in murder town, or as we also know it, Greensboro.  And who are all these young kids?  Then it’s on to the Norwegian import, ‘The Worst Person In The World’.  Getting lots of buzz, including a Best Actress win at Cannes, it’s another slice of life, coming of age film we’ve been specializing in lately.  But does it offer something different?  There’s the life-altering review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show closes with Matt and Chris sharing their 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films. Hola, Sidney!

00:00-18:40: Intro/Scream (2022)

18:41-27:44: Physical Media Picks

27:45-37:45: The Worst Person In The World

37:46-54:24: 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films

54:25-55:53: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 589: The Tragedy Of Macbeth, C’Mon C’Mon, 5 Favorite Passion Projects
item.description:
It’s a week of Black & White films.  In fact, in honor of the films, we recorded this in black and white.  And mono. This may be the episode that breaks Matt. Because first up, It’s Joel Coen’s adaptation of the classic ‘The Tragedy Of Macbeth’.  Denzel Washington plays the titular Macbeth.  Can it’s streamlined production save it from Matt’s wrath?  Then it’s on to Mike Mills’ ‘C’Mon C’Mon’.  A slice of life film featuring Joaquin Phoenix in the thoughtful, sensitive role that perhaps further cements him as one of our greatest living actors. There’s the essential listening that is the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show then closes as Matt and Chris share their 5 Favorite Passion Projects, featuring Travolta, Bruno, Spielberg, and more!

00:00-19:09: Intro/The Tragedy Of Macbeth

19:10-37:15: Physical Media Picks

37:16-49:44: C’Mon C’Mon

49:45-1:13:25: 5 Favorite Passion Projects

1:13:26-1:15:13: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey
item.content:encoded:
It’s a week of Black & White films.  In fact, in honor of the films, we recorded this in black and white.  And mono. This may be the episode that breaks Matt. Because first up, It’s Joel Coen’s adaptation of the classic ‘The Tragedy Of Macbeth’.  Denzel Washington plays the titular Macbeth.  Can it’s streamlined production save it from Matt’s wrath?  Then it’s on to Mike Mills’ ‘C’Mon C’Mon’.  A slice of life film featuring Joaquin Phoenix in the thoughtful, sensitive role that perhaps further cements him as one of our greatest living actors. There’s the essential listening that is the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show then closes as Matt and Chris share their 5 Favorite Passion Projects, featuring Travolta, Bruno, Spielberg, and more!

00:00-19:09: Intro/The Tragedy Of Macbeth

19:10-37:15: Physical Media Picks

37:16-49:44: C’Mon C’Mon

49:45-1:13:25: 5 Favorite Passion Projects

1:13:26-1:15:13: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 588: Licorice Pizza, The King’s Man, Call It!
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the latest from the director of Chris’ favorite film of the 21st Century, PTA returns with ‘Licorice Pizza’.  A coming-of-age story in early 70’s LA. A little slice of life film that’s received some heat in the online discourse regarding the purposeful age gap of our stars.  What’s up with that?  Then its on to the latest film from Matthew Vaughn as he continues the expansion of the Kingsmen franchise with an origin story, ‘The King’s Man’.  How did the super-duper private British intelligence agency come about? And does anyone else find it weird watching M as a kick butt secret agent?  There’s the completely enrapturing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with another round of ‘Call It’! Featuring Chris Hemsworth, Brian Mills, Sydney Prescott, the Blair Witch, and more!

00:00-23:24: Intro/Licorice Pizza

23:25-29:45: Physical Media Picks

29:46-37:29: The King’s Man

37:30-56:04: Call It!

56:05-58:36: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 587: Matrix: Resurrections, Don’t Look Up, 5 Favorite Adam McKay Scenes
item.description:
This week on the last episode of 2021 of The First Run, Chris and Matt share their thoughts on The Matrix: Resurrections.  Lana Wachowski returns to the franchise that changed cinema with a new story to tell.  But a story perhaps somewhat influenced by a studio with perhaps a concern for a payday and not a new artistic endeavor.  Keanu Reeves and Carrie Anne Moss return, certain other decisions are made, and a sci-fi franchise is brought back to life.  But things ended so perfectly last time, should we be plugging back in?  Then Adam McKay continues his run of all-star casts, political commentary, and possibly diminishing laughs with the eco-disaster political satire, ‘Don’t Look Up’.  Leonardo DiCaprio leads McKay’s film with an important message that either lands or crashes.  There’s the final rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris attempt to close out the year with some laughs as they share their 5 Favorite Adam McKay scenes.  It’s just another episode of the show that escalated quickly.

00:00-20:27: Intro/Matrix: Resurrections

20:28-26:52: Physical Media Picks

26:53-40:10: Don’t Look Up

40:11-54:34: 5 Favorite Adam McKay Scenes

54:35-56:17: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 586: Spider-Man: No Way Home, Nightmare Alley, 10 Most Anticipated Films of 2022
item.description:
This week on a special non-holiday version of The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Matt’s most anticipated film of the year. It’s finally here, Tom Holland stars in Jon Watts’ ‘Spider-Man: No Way Home’.  Marvel’s flagship character completes his trilogy with laughs, loves, shocks and thrills.  But can it actually meet Matt’s lofty expectations?  Then, on any other weekend, Guillermo Del Toro’s latest film, ‘Nightmare Alley’ dropped to little fanfare.  The former Best Director and Picture winner delivers his adaptation of a little known, but classic film noir from 1947.  Does Del Toro imagination improve on the original, or was it better leaving well enough alone?  There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week, likely delivered by elves since we fired all the interns.  The show then closes with Matt and Chris sharing their 10 Most Anticipated Films of 2022. Come on Avatar 2!

item.title: TFR Ep. 585: West Side Story, Black Friday, 5 Favorite Spielberg Films
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Matt’s movie advent calendar lights its second to last candle as we are 1 week away from Spider-Man No Way Home.  To hold Matt over, we’re discussing a film from his favorite genre, musicals.  It’s ‘West Side Story’ from the man who does not miss, Steven Spielberg.  Is now just the right time to unleash upon the world a romantic dramatic tragedy about potential irreconcilable conflicts between two groups.  Can they possible put their differences aside in the name of love? And can we?  Then to ease tensions, Matt and Chris settle in on a cold wintery night with a few old friends, it’s ‘Black Friday’.  A meta film about the evils of the consumerism side of the holidays.  There’s the heart-warming rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  The big show then wraps with Chris and Matt sharing their 5 Favorite Spielberg Films.

00:00-17:27: Intro/West Side Story ‘21

17:28-28:13: Physical Media Picks

28:14-37:05: Black Friday

37:06-50:23: 5 Favorite Spielberg Films

50:24-51:15: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 584: The Power Of The Dog, Benedetta, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Jane Campion’s latest film with a stellar ensemble of Benedict Cumberbatch, Benedict’s Cumberbatch, America’s sweetheart Jesse Plemons, Kirsten Dunst, and Kodi Smith-McPhee in the Netflix original, ‘The Power of The Dog’. A western about masculinity, love, and violence.  Then Paul Verhoeven has entered the twilight years of his career.  Is he still turning out bangers? That’s right, it’s the not quite nunsploitation thriller, ‘Benedetta’. There’s the always illuminating review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week!  The big show then closes with Matt and Chris playing another round of your favorite fill-in-the-blank game, ‘TFR Libs’!  

Note: Not only does Chris misquote ‘It’s A Wonderful Life’, it’s..”I’ll love you ‘til the day I die”, but he also incorrectly dates ‘Black Xmas’ as a 90’s film when it was clearly released in 2006.  There goes another intern.  At Christmas no less…

00:00-11:50: Intro/The Power Of The Dog

11:51-21:00: Physical Media Picks

21:01-33:47: Benedetta

33:48-51:27: TFR Libs

51:28-53:07: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 583: King Richard, Resident Evil: Welcome To Raccoon City, Who Dat?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the obvious Oscar bait film that is ‘King Richard’.  Does the story of Richard Williams, the drive behind Venus and Serena Williams’ career, give Will Smith the ability to finally net that elusive Best Actor statue?  Then Resident Evil goes the reboot route with ‘Welcome To Raccoon City’.  The film sticks closer to the games, which may be a delight for the fans, but does it break the video game movie curse?  I mean it HAS to be better than the Paul WS Anderson run, right?  RIGHT?!?  There’s the life changing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show with their 2nd favorite, non-spouse swapping role playing game, ‘Who Dat?!?’. This week featuring special appearances by Jared Leto, a special Twitter account, and…Matt…?  Let’s get to listening!

00:00-11:22: Intro/King Richard

11:23-22:42: Physical Media Picks

22:43-32:28: Resident Evil: Welcome To Raccoon City

32:29-55:08: Who Dat?!?

55:09-56:35: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 582: Ghostbusters: Afterlife, The Harder They Fall, What Are The Odds?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt see if you really can go home again.  The latest attempt to revive a beloved franchise, or at least that first film, is helmed by the son of the original director, features appearances of the original cast, and is overstuffed with homages. That’s right, it’s Ghostbusters: Afterlife.  Does it capture the magic of the 1984 original and justify its existence?  Then it’s on to the Netflix original, featuring current Hollywood ‘It Guy’, Johnathan Majors as real-life cowboy, Nat Love, on a quest for vengeance in ‘The Harder They Fall’.  Matt loves him some westerns, so surely this will be right up his alley!  There’s the riveting discussion of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the big show with a truly stunning round of ‘What Are The Odds?!?’ in all it’s hyperbolic glory!  Happy Black Friday shopping gang!

00:00-15:04: Intro/Ghostbusters: Afterlife

15:05-24:02: Physical Media Picks

24:03-31:25: The Harder They Fall

31:26-48:05: What Are The Odds?!?

48:06-50:20: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Focus Ep. 23: National Treasure(s), 5 Best Nic Cage Films
item.description:
On this special episode of TFR Focus, Chris and Matt are joined by Gomez of Playlist Wars to discuss one of his favorite actors and franchises, Nic Cage and National Treasure!  It’s guest’s choice this time as Gomez wants to breakdown Nic Cage and Disney’s National Treasure films.  Not only that, but then the guys tick off their 5 Favorite Nic Cage Performances! item.title: TFR Ep. 581: Red Notice, Finch, 2021 Holiday Gift Guide
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the Netflix blockbuster, per Netflix, ‘Red Notice’.  Featuring 3 of today’s biggest stars!  Has a new action franchise been born?  And is that a good thing?  Then AppleTV+ has their own premiere, featuring America’s Dad, Tom Hanks in a heart-warming tale about the apocalypse.  It’s ‘Finch’!  There’s the deliriously entertaining rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week!  Then it’s one of Matt’s favorite segments we do, our 2021 Holiday Gift Guide for the movie lover in your life.  Or you.

item.title: TFR Ep. 580: Eternals, The French Dispatch, 5 Best Wes Anderson Characters
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss ‘Eternals’, the latest film from the MCU, directed by your most recent Best Picture and Director winner, one Ms. Chloé Zhao.  Initially concerned it was going to be a gorgeous looking bore, with it also being the lowest rated MCU film on Rotten Tomatoes, can it actually be…good..?  Then Wes Anderson returns with his latest project filled with whimsy and quirk, ‘The French Dispatch’. Featuring his typical all star cast, does Anderson deliver another odd, enthralling film?  There’s the venerable rundown of the big releases in Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Wes Anderson characters.  Will your favorite make the cut?  Come on Dingman!   

00:00-18:15: Intro/Eternals

18:16-29:10: Physical Media Picks

29:11-39:39: The French Dispatch

39:40-48:38: 5 Favorite Wes Anderson Characters

48:39-51:19: Wrap Up 

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 579: Last Night In Soho, Antlers, Dead Ringers, Body Horror Marathon Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt have another triple feature in store for all you!  First Up, TFR favorite Edgar Wright deliver’s his version of the giallo with a possible dusting of time travel thrown in with, ‘Last Night In Soho’, featuring Thomasin McKenzie and Anya Taylor-Joy. Wright has yet to make a bad film, could this be the first one?  Then it’s on to the horror film, ‘Antlers’, featuring an interesting monster and a dash about eco-horror.  From there the Body Horror Marathon wraps up with David Cronenberg’s ‘Dead Ringers’, featuring Jeremy Irons and Genevieve Bujold.  There’s the always thrilling review of the big release on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their Body Horror Marathon Awards.  It’s been an odd marathon with what you may think are obvious choices.  Only way to know for sure is to listen dear friends!

00:00-14:24: Intro/Last Night In Soho

14:25-20:51: Antlers

20:52-29:46: Physical Media Picks

29:47-38:04: Dead Ringers

38:05-47:32: Body Horror Marathon Awards

47:33-49:20: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 578: WNUF Halloween Special, V/H/S/94, Halloween Streaming Picks
item.description:
On this special Halloween episode of The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss two Shudder exclusives.  First up it’s the possibly soon-to-be cult classic, the ‘WNUF Halloween Special’.  A film designed to look like a bootleg VHS copy of a local news Halloween Special that goes horribly wrong.  Then the V/H/S anthology series returns with 4 new stories with ‘V/H/S/94’. Can the series conquer the anthology film trap of being terribly uneven with this latest entry?  And finally as Halloween night is upon us, Matt and Chris share a horror movie pick for the streaming service of your choice.  Basically all of them.  So cuddle up, lock the doors, and settle in for a spooky Halloween special from your ghoulish friends at The First Run!

00:00-07:33: Intro/WNUF Halloween Special

07:34-19:19: V/H/S/94

19:20-32:52: Horror Streaming Picks

32:53-34:04: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 577: Dune, The Last Duel, Lamb, The Incredible Melting Man, Call It!
item.description:
Guys. Holy crap guys. This week, the show is simply bursting with content. First, Chris and Matt discuss the much-anticipated Dune: Part 1, the passion project of First Run favorite Denis Villeneuve. Is it gorgeous? Is it exciting? Is it as weird as its source material? Only one way to find out. Well, two if you count watching yourselves. The guys then give you not one, but two, bonus discussions on Ridley Scott's latest sword and shield historical epic, The Last Duel, and an Icelandic horror fairy tale thing with Lamb. Then the Body Horror Marathon continues with The Incredible Melting Man, one of the only films reviewed for the podcast that is also the subject of an MST3K episode. So there's that. As always, we give our Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week, Chris runs down the physical media releases because you'll pry his 4k disks from his cold, dead hands and wrap it up with a spooky season edition of Call It! What are you waiting for?! Get in here!

00:00-22:32: Intro/Dune

22:33-33:27: The Last Duel

33:28-42:22: Lamb

42:23-49:11: Physical Media Picks

49:12-57:15: The Incredible Melting Man

57:16-01:10:42: Call It!

01:10:43-01:12:22: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 576: Halloween Kills, Tetsuo: The Iron Man, 5 Favorite Michael Myers Kills
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt don their bleached Bill Shatner masks and settle for the highest kill count for any Michael Myers film with, ‘Halloween Kills’.  And brother does it ever.  But does a high body count translate to a good film?  Then the Body Horror Marathon continues with Japanese cult classic, ‘Tetsuo: The Iron Man’.  What would you do if you hit a guy with your car that was obsessed with transforming his body with various metal objects and so much worse?  How bad could it get?  Very bad apparently.  There’s the positively riveting review of the big releases Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week!  Then Matt and Chris close out the proceedings with their 5 Favorite Michael Myers Kills!  Which on of your favorites will make the cut?  Listen on to find out!

00:00-15:00: Intro/Halloween Kills

15:01-23:01: Physical Media Picks

23:02-31:50: Tetsuo: The Iron Man

31:51-40:25: 5 Best Michael Myers Kills

40:26-43:02: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Twitter

Instagram

Facebook
item.content:encoded:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt don their bleached Bill Shatner masks and settle for the highest kill count for any Michael Myers film with, ‘Halloween Kills’.  And brother does it ever.  But does a high body count translate to a good film?  Then the Body Horror Marathon continues with Japanese cult classic, ‘Tetsuo: The Iron Man’.  What would you do if you hit a guy with your car that was obsessed with transforming his body with various metal objects and so much worse?  How bad could it get?  Very bad apparently.  There’s the positively riveting review of the big releases Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week!  Then Matt and Chris close out the proceedings with their 5 Favorite Michael Myers Kills!  Which on of your favorites will make the cut?  Listen on to find out!

item.title: TFR Ep. 575: No Time To Die, Rabid, 5 Best Bond Gadgets
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris’ long wait for the Daniel Craig’s final outing as James Bond is over as after multiple delays, ‘No Time To Die’ is finally here.  Matt saw it too.  After all this time and all the self-imposed hype by Chris, can it possible stand up to his lofty expectations and be the perfect send off for Craig?  Then the Body Horror Marathon continues with David Cronenberg’s ‘Rabid’.  If you ever wondered what would happen if you were in a bad motorcycle accident and had to be cared for by the local experimental plastic surgery shop as the closest hospital was too far away and then you developed some weird deformity that made you feed on blood and then infect your victims with their own insatiable need for blood, we have the film for you.  There’s the venerable rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Bond Gadgets!  How many of them are cars?  Any exploding pens or magnetic watches?  Listen to find out Double O fans!

00:00-16:57: Intro/No Time To Die

16:58-32:09: No Time To Die Spoilers and More

32:10-40:16: Physical Media Picks

40:17-48:12: Rabid

48:13-58:24: 5 Favorite Bond Gadgets

58:25-01:00:31: Wrap Up

 Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 574: Venom: Let There Be Carnage, Titane, Tokyo Gore Police, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt check back in with their old buddy Eddie Brock and his symbiotic pal, Venom in ‘Venom: Let There Be Carnage’! With the original being as flawed as it was, does director Andy Serkis right the ship and deliver a superior sequel?  Or should we just head to the closest bell tower and be done with it?  Chris shares his thoughts on that French horror film where the woman gets impregnated by a car.  Is ‘Titane’ one of the best films of the year?!?  Then our Body Horror Marathon continues with ‘Tokyo Gore Police’.  One of the more gore-soaked films Matt and Chris have seen, that may be as disastrous as it is fun.  There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then they guys close out the show with another round of everyone’s fill-in-the-blank game, TFR Libs, featuring some James Bond casting calls, 80’s movies sequels, and more!

 00:00-16:24: Intro/Venom: Let There Be Carnage

16:25-20:31: Titane

20:32-29:04: Physical Media Picks

29:05-35:23: Tokyo Gore Police

35:24-51:05: TFR Libs

item.title: TFR Ep. 573: Copshop, The Empty Man, 5 Horror Double Features
item.description:
This week on The First Run, the bois chat about 'CopShop’. Gerard Butler and an almost unrecognizable Frank Grillo glare it up and make threats in this tough guy action-crime film. Then we kick-off the spooky season with ‘The Empty’ Man," a horror film that hits many different genre beats and ends up in a place completely different from where it started. Do we have an undiscovered horror cult classic in the making? We just might, gentle listeners. We just might. As always, Chris tells you what he thinks the big releases on physical media are, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week. The show is all wrapped up with five horror double features recommendations from each of your esteemed hosts. Don't miss this one or you will be sad and no one wants that.

00:00-11:16: Intro/Copshop

11:17-23:55: Physical Media Picks

23:56-33:40: The Empty Man

33:41-48:37: 5 Horror Double Features

48:38-52:20: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 572: Cry Macho, Karen, Who Dat?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss ‘Cry Macho’, as a now 91 year old Clint Eastwood directs and stars in this neo-Western, but has he aged out of the role?  Then BET presents ‘Karen’.  A horror film for our times?  A misguided cry for action?  Or a camp classic?  There’s the thrilling review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with another round of everyone’s favorite role-playing segment, ‘Who Dat?!?’!  This time featuring Christopher Nolan, Daniel Craig, Kevin Feige, and more!

item.title: TFR Ep. 571: Malignant, Kate, 5 Favorite James Wan Scenes
item.description:
This week on the big show, Chris and Matt discuss James Wan's return to the horror genre, "Malignant." Is this the body horror-Giallo-80's-Euro Horror mash-up that EVERYbody has been clamoring for all these years or is this a case of too many ingredients spoiling the stew? Then our mini-marathon of films with a woman's first name kicks-off with Mary Elizabeth Winsted in "Kate," as MEW Jane Wicks her way across Japan in a Netflix exclusive action flick. As always. Chris runs down the "big" releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  We wrap the show with our Top 5 James Wan Scenes because we know you are just dying to know what we think. You can't wait to listen!

item.title: TFR Ep. 570: Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings , Stillwater, 5 Favorite MCU Villains
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chis and Matt discuss the latest film in the MCU as Phase 4 continues with ‘Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings’.  Wait, 10 Rings?  Didn’t we see that in Iron Man 3?  Does Shang-Chi escape its MCU template, or is it just another ride on the same merry-go-around, again?  Then Matt Damon stars in Tom McCarthy’s ‘Stillwater’.  After helming a Best Picture winner with ‘Spotlight’, then a Disney+ adaptation of the Timmy Failure book series, McCarthy returns with a fictionalized take of the Amanda Knox story.  Or not.  There’s the positively delicious review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  The show then wraps with Matt and Chris sharing their 5 Favorite MCU Villains.  Who makes the cut; Klaw? Blacklash? JJJ?!?  Tune in to find out!

00:00-17:14: Intro/Shang Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings

17:15-30:22: Physical Media Picks

30:23-38:41: Stillwater

38:42-49:23: 5 Favorite MCU Villains

49:24-51:17: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 569: Candyman, Harakiri, Samurai Marathon Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the softest of soft sequels, Nia Dacosta’s ‘Candyman’.  Does this new version live up to the bloody legacy of the first or is this yet another entry in the long line of films that should have been left well enough alone?  Then our Samurai Marathon wraps up with Masaki Kobayashi’s ‘Harakiri’. This is apparently one of the best jidaigeki films ever made. Will your esteemed film scholar hosts agree? Most likely but listen to what we have to say anyway! As always we rundown of the important releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then the show closes with Chris and Matt awarding our Palme d’Esposito awards for the Samurai Marathon. If you missed this one, you would bring great shame to your daimyo and your house!

00:00-22:29: Intro/Candyman

22:30-34:16: Physical Media Picks

34:17-45:17: Harakiri

45:18-55:00: Samurai Marathon Awards

55:01-56:03: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.itunes:summary:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the softest of soft sequels, Nia Dacosta’s ‘Candyman’. Does this new version live up to the bloody legacy of the first or is this yet another entry in the long line of films that should have been left well enough alone? Then our Samurai Marathon wraps up with Masaki Kobayashi’s ‘Harakiri’. This is apparently one of the best jidaigeki films ever made. Will your esteemed film scholar hosts agree? Most likely but listen to what we have to say anyway! As always we rundown of the important releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Then the show closes with Chris and Matt awarding our Palme d’Esposito awards for the Samurai Marathon. If you missed this one, you would bring great shame to your daimyo and your house!
00:00-22:29: Intro/Candyman 22:30-34:16: Physical Media Picks 34:17-45:17: Harakiri 45:18-55:00: Samurai Marathon Awards 55:01-56:03: Wrap Up
Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 568: Reminiscence, The Night House, Spider-Man: No Way Home Trailer, Ugetsu, 5 Favorite Flashbacks
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss ‘Reminiscence’.  Hugh Jackman stars in this sci-fi neo-noir as he looks for the missing wrong woman that captured his heart and then disappeared.  Will he like what he finds?  From the mind of Lisa Joy, one of the creators of HBO’s Westworld.  Chris then shares his thoughts about Rebecca Hall and the horror film that’s not quite what you think it is, ‘The Night House’.  The Samurai Marathon sort of continues with Kenji Mizoguchi’s ‘Ugetsu’. The classic adaptation of Ueda Akinari's tales ‘The House in the Thicket’ and ‘The Lust of the White Serpent’. There’s some talk of the new ‘Spider-Man: Far From Home’ trailer.  Then the show closes with the guys’ sharing their 5 Favorite Flashbacks in movies! You can save this episode and relive it over and over!

00:00-11:39: Reminiscence

11:40-14:12: The Night House

14:13-22:58: Physical Media Picks

22:59-29:02: Spider-Man: No Way Home Trailer

29:03-34:49: Ugetsu

34:50-53:42: 5 Favorite Flashbacks

53:43-56:01: Wrap Up/Outtake

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey
