item.title: TFR Ep. 567: Free Guy, The Tale Of Zatoichi, What Are The Odds?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the Ryan Reynolds starred comedy, ‘Free Guy’.  Reynolds plays a NPC who gains sentience and begins to long for something more.  And it’s funny! Right?!?  Then the Samurai Marathon continues with ‘The Tale Of Zatoichi’, the first film in the beloved and long-running series.  After the cinematic hurricanes that were the first two entries in the marathon, we get a more contemplative film.  Was that better?  There’s the marvelous rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week!  The show then closes as Matt and Chris engage in a little gambling with the return of ‘What Are The Odds?’.  Will ScarJo win her lawsuit?  Will ‘Dune’ at least break even? That and more on this week’s show.

00:00-11:10: Intro/Free Guy

11:11-22:58: Physical Media Picks

22:59-32:42: The Tale Of Zatoichi

32:43-58:32: What Are The Odds?

58:33-59:58: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 566: The Suicide Squad, Shogun Assassin, 5 DC Characters Deserving Their Own Movie
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt are joined by friend of the show, Sean to breakdown the DCEU’s potential soft reboot with James Gunn’s ‘The Suicide Squad’. Has the DCEU found their path forward?  Or is a hard R rated superhero film not exactly the best way to obtain mass appeal?  Then our Samurai Marathon continues with the mashup of the first two films in the classic Lone Wolf & Cub films series with ‘Shogun Assassin’.  Can this American bastardization actually churn out an entertaining martial arts thriller?  There’s the regularly astounding review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Matt, Chris, and Sean then close out the show by sharing 5 DC Comic Properties Deserving Their Own Movie.  Who makes the cut?  And can we finally get that Mister Mxyzptlk vs Bat-Mite film we’ve longed for? 

00:00-24:03: Intro/The Suicide Squad

24:04-38:22: Physical Media Picks & Criterion UHD

38:23-51:00: Shogun Assassin

51:01-1:17:47: 5 DC Characters Deserving Their Own Movie

1:17:48-1:20:27: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 565: The Green Knight, The Sword Of Doom, Call It!
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss David Lowery adaptation of a classic 14th century poem of Camelot with ‘The Green Knight’. Dev Patel stars as Gawain on his quest to become a knight and demonstrate all that title’s characteristics.  Then our Samurai Marathon begins with Kihachi Okamoto’s ‘The Sword Of Doom’! A tale of a samurai slipping into not just madness, but something darker.  There’s the venerable review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Finally, Matt and Chris close out the show with a round of Call It.  Who would be a worst Indiana Jones? Alan Rickman or Karl Urban? And more! Take listen and find out!

00:00-14:10: Intro/The Green Knight

14:11-22:08: Physical Media Picks

22:09-31:03: The Sword Of Doom

31:04-47:56: Call It!

47:57-49:36: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 564: Snake Eyes, Old, 5 Favorite GI Joe Characters
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the newest film in the GI Joe cinematic universe, ‘Snake Eyes: GI Joe Origins’.  We finally get the story behind the franchise’s most popular character as Henry Golden steps into the role.  So does the franchise finally get on the right track? Or have the rolled snake eyes again…? (sorry) Then it’s M. Knight Shyamalan’s latest, ‘Old’.  In this thriller, a group of people find themselves on a secluded beach, aging very rapidly.  How do the escape and what is really going on?  And should you care?  There’s the venerable rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then wrap up the show by sharing their 5 Favorite GI Joe Characters.  And now you know.  And knowing is half the battle.

00:00-16:08: Intro/Snake Eyes

16:09-24:24: Physical Media Picks

24:25-35:43: Old

35:44-49:19: 5 Favorite GI Joe Characters

49:20-52:37: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 563: Pig, The Tomorrow War, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the anti-John Wick non-revenge film ‘Pig’, featuring Mr. “Yes, I’ll Do It” Nicholas Cage.  A man who doesn’t know how to say no to any project, sometimes may find the diamond in the rough. Could this be one of those times…?  Then it’s on the Amazon Prime sci-fi actioner, ‘The Tomorrow War’.  Chris Pratt leads a fight against aliens. In the FUTURE!  So why has Chris Pratt’s favor begun to fall as he is now regularly dead last in the Hollywood Chris’s ranking.  There’s the getting entirely too long review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show with everyone’s favorite fill-in-the-blank game, TFR Libs.  

00:00-08:41: Intro/Pig

08:42-22:53: Physical Media Picks

22:54-36:42: The Tomorrow War

36:43-58:04: TFR Libs

58:05-59:41: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 562: Black Widow, Luca, 5 Marvel Characters Deserving Their Own Film
item.description:
This week on The First Run, the MCU experience returns for Chris and Matt as they discuss ‘Black Widow’.  After 22 films, 7 of which she is featured, 1 of which she dies, Scarlett Johannsson’s Natasha Romanoff finally gets her own film.  Or does she?  Then our domination by Disney continues with Pixar’s latest, debuting exclusively on Disney+, ‘Luca’.  Sea monsters, kids, Italy!  What does the marvelous studio have in store for us this time?  There’s the rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close the show by sharing 5 Marvel Characters Deserving Their Own Film.  We’re looking at you Spot!

00:00-26:54: Intro/Black Widow

26:55-39:17: Physical Media Picks

39:18-47:43: Luca

47:44-1:05:28: 5 Marvel Characters Deserving Their Own Film

1:05:29-1:07:35: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 561: Zola, No Sudden Move, Who Dat?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, it’s EXTREME-casting.  Tropical storm/Hurricane Elsa is bearing down on Florida and JC of Screenfix is here to once again drive Chris insane. First up, it’s the Twitter thread come to life black comedy road trip epic that is ‘Zola’.  Primarily shot locally here in Tampa, Chris hopes to identify all the local spots and see if this whole thing actually works, but is quickly undone by JC’s unique, we’ll say, perspective.  Then it’s on to Steven Soderbergh’s latest streaming exclusively on HBOMax, ‘No Sudden Move’.  Soderbergh returns to the twisty heist flick featuring a stellar cast out to get their hands on an incredibly dull McGuffin.  And more arguments are had. There’re the big releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week!  The show then wraps with Chris’s first time role playing with a guest in ‘Who Dat’.  It’s always awkward the first time.  Join us for 90 minutes of entertaining madness as Chris is finally put in his place.

00:00-30:05: Intro/Zola (seriously, 30 minutes)

30:06-43:17: Physical Media Picks

43:18-1:03:20: No Sudden Move

1:03:21-1:25:54: Who Dat?!?

1:25:55-1:29:30: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 560: F9, Werewolves Within, 5 Films Improved By Adding Vin Diesel
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt put the pedal to the metal and discuss the latest film in the fast car go boom franchise with ‘F9: The Fast Saga’.  What shenanigans can Vin and the family get into on behalf of America?  And wait…there’s a long-lost brother?!?  What about “family”?!?  Then it’s on to the monster who-dun-it, ‘Werewolves Within’, featuring Sam Richardson and Milana Vayntrub. How many people could a werewolf kill if the werewolf could kill people?  All of them I guess.  But who IS the werewolf…?  There’s the always rambunctious review of the big releases on physical media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The big show then closes with 5 Films that could be improved by digitally replacing an actor with Vin Diesel.  No the correct answer isn’t “all of them”.

00:00-20:00: Intro/F9

20:01-29:55: Physical Media Picks

29:56-36:37: Werewolves Within

36:38-53:02: 5 Films Improved By Adding Vin Diesel

53:03-54:32: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 559: The Hitman’s Wife’s Bodyguard, Prospect, 5 Worst Movie Dads
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the surprise sequel, ‘The Hitman’s Wife’s Bodyguard’. All your favorites return, Ryan Reynolds, Sam Jackson, & Salma Hayek!  We can only go up from here!  Right…right? [Insert Anakin & Padme meme].  Then it’s on to the sci-fi thriller, ‘Prospect’, featuring First Run Favorite, Pedro Pascal.  He’s a not-so-nice guy that ends up teamed with a young woman as they try and find their way home.  In space.  There’s the rundown of the big releases in Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then the show closes with Matt and Chris sharing their picks for the 5 Worst Movie Dads in honor of this past week’s Father’s day.  And also the fact that both films this week have some weird things to say about families.  So we’ve got that going for us, I guess. 

00:00-11:25: Intro/The Hitman’s Wife’s Bodyguard

11:26-25:30: Physical Media Picks

25:31-37:20: Prospect

37:21-54:30: 5 Worst Movie Dads

54:31-57:02: Wrap Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 558: In The Heights, The Woman In The Window, 5 Film Improved By Becoming A Musical
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Matt takes another week off, sunning in the Riviera.  So The Lady Wan takes pity on Chris and joins him to discuss ‘In The Heights’.  Can a musical save Hollywood, the theatrical experience, and America itself?  Then The Lady Wan and Chris discuss adaption of the hit novel, ‘The Woman In The Window’.  Just how many times can we remake ‘Rear Window’?  This time, it’s Joe Wright’s turn, director of one of the best films of the aughts, ‘Atonement’.  There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  The celebration ends with Chris and The Lady Wan sharing their 5 Films That Would Be Improved By Becoming A Musical?  And no, ‘Halloween’ just wouldn’t work.

00:00-16:53: Intro/In The Heights

16:54-25:30: Physical Media Picks

25:31-35:24: The Woman In The Window

35:25-51:21: 5 Film Improved By Becoming A Musical

51:22-54:07: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Twitter

Instagram

Facebook

item.title: TFR Ep. 557: The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It, Oxygen, 5 Horror Films Based On A True Story
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt spend a couple hours in Chris’s favorite decade, the 80’s.  It’s 1981 specifically Start Me Up, Stop Dragging My Heart Around, Who’s Crying Now are on the radio.  The theaters feature Time Bandits, Escape From New York, The Evil Dead, Stripes.  And some whack job gets possessed and kills his landlord, sparking the trial the shocked America.  That’s right, it’s The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It.  The latest entry in the wildly successful, but extremely hit and miss franchise.  Then our horror tour continues with the latest from Alexandre Aja, one of the members of the French Horror New Wave in the early aughts’ latest, ‘Oxygen’, featuring Melanie Laurent.  This time Aja dabbles more in the sci-fi/thriller genre, with some shoe-horned in horror to keep the horror buffs placated. There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show by sharing their 5 Favorite Horror Films Bases On A True Story.  So grab your wooby, curl up by the fire, and settle in for some scares!

00:00-14:41: Intro/The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It

14:42-22:39: Physical Media Picks

22:40-30:21: Oxygen

30:22-47:06: 5 Favorite Horror Films Based On A True Story

47:07-48:46: Wrap Up 

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Be

Instagram

item.title: TFR Ep. 556: A Quiet Place 2, The Mitchells Vs The Machines, What Are The Odds?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss John Krasinski’s sequel to the surprise horror hit with ‘A Quiet Place Part II’.  This time the Abbott family venture out from their hidden-away home to find any survivors while doing their darndest to be as quiet as possible.  But what if those survivors are no longer good people…?  Then it’s on to Netflix’s ‘The Mitchells Vs. The Machines’.  A struggling family on a road trip end up having to save the world from a robot apocalypse in this animated family comedy.  There’s the rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  The show then closes as Matt and Chris play another round of What Are The Odds, featuring James Bond, Indiana Jones, MGM, and more!

00:00-15:42: Intro/A Quiet Place Part 2

15:43-27:18: Physical Media Picks

27:19-35:54: The Mitchells Vs The Machines

35:55-55:56: What Are The Odds?!?

55:57-57:37: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 555: Army Of The Dead, Riders Of Justice, 5 Streaming Horror Films
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with their old buddy Zack Snyder, fresh of his global smash hit, ‘Justice League’, Snyder returns to his roots with his remake of ‘Aliens’.  Sorry, sorry, ‘Army Of The Dead’.  Teaming with Dave Bautista as the leader of a group infiltrating the zombie held territory that is Las Vegas to pull off a heist that would make Danny Ocean poop himself.  Then it’s on to the Danish import, ‘Riders of Justice’.  TFR favorite Mads Mikkelsen plays a soldier brought home after an unspeakable accident takes the life of his wife and traumatizes his daughter.  But what if it wasn’t an accident?  There’s the reasonably reliable review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close the show by sharing 5 Horror gems currently available to stream. 

 

00:00-22:17: Army Of The Dead

22:18-30:14: Physical Media Picks

30:15-37:33: Riders Of Justice

37:34-55:32: 5 Streaming Horror Recommendations

55:33-57:04: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Instagram

Facebook

Sorry, sorry, ‘Army Of The Dead’. Teaming with Dave Bautista as the leader of a group infiltrating the zombie held territory that is Las Vegas to pull off a heist that would make Danny Ocean poop himself. Then it’s on to the Danish import, ‘Riders of Justice’. TFR favorite Mads Mikkelsen plays a soldier brought home after an unspeakable accident takes the life of his wife and traumatizes his daughter. But what if it wasn’t an accident? There’s the reasonably reliable review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Then Matt and Chris close the show by sharing 5 Horror gems currently available to stream.
00:00-22:17: Army Of The Dead 22:18-30:14: Physical Media Picks 30:15-37:33: Riders Of Justice 37:34-55:32: 5 Streaming Horror Recommendations 55:33-57:04: Wrap Up
Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 554: Spiral, Those Who Wish Me Dead, Call It!
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss ‘Spiral: From The Book of Saw’.  Chris Rock stars and co-wrote this spin-off that breathes new life into a tired franchise by examining police brutality while capitalizing on the opportunity to have Rock and Sam Jackson play a father/son cop duo.  Or maybe it doesn’t do that at all.  Then it’s on to Tyler Sheridan’s latest, ‘Those Who Wish Me Dead’.  A film that features a rock solid cast from a director know for his adult (non-porn) dramatic thrillers.  Is this story of a child on the run from some corrupt government officials and their hired killers who run into tortured fire jumper Angelina Jolie. Plus John Berenthal!  There’s the absolutely thrilling review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close the show with another round of Pick ‘Em with Call It!  What is Tom Cruise’s definitive role? 

00:00-16:11: Intro/Spiral

16:12-27:29: Physical Media Picks

27:30-37:51: Those Who Wish Me Dead

37:52-51:49: Call It!

51:50-54:32: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 553: Wrath Of Man, Unhinged, 5 Great Streaming Action Films
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Matt is away, so Chris is joined by his ScreenRun colleague, The Lady Wan, to discuss Guy Ritchie’s and Jason Statham’s latest team-up, the revenge/heist/actioner ‘Wrath Of Man’.  Statham plays a bank truck driver who may be more than he appears.  Expect lots of bodies, blood, and nastiness.  But is it a fun watch?  Then it’s the Russell Crowe led thriller, ‘Unhinged’.  Crowe does his version of the Michael Douglas/’Falling Down’ thing.  But is the cranked-up-to-11 nastiness rob of the film of its potentially pulpy charms?  There’s the always riveting rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then the show closes with The Lady Wan and Chris sharing some of their favorite Action Films Currently Streaming.  Let’s kick some ass!

00:00-15:28: Intro/Wrath Of Man

15:29-24:18: Physical Media Picks

24:19-36:27: Unhinged

36:28-55:40: 5 Great Streaming Action Films

55:41-58:08: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 552: Another Round, Shiva Baby, 5 Favorite Alcohol Related Scenes
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt set ‘em up and knock ‘em down as they discuss this year’s Best International Feature winner at The Oscars, ‘Another Round’.  TFR favorite Mads Mikkelson stars as one of four teachers that experiment with alcohol to improve their lives as they face a mid-life crisis.  Ahhh, sweet, sweet booze.  Then Chris spends 10 minutes or so completely naïve of the different definitions of “shiva” as he and Matt review the indie cringe comedy of the decade, ‘Shiva Baby’.  There’s the terrifingly wonderful rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show with their 5 Favorite Alcohol Related Scenes. Chug! Chug! Chug! Chug!

15:32-26:18: Physical Media Picks

26:19-37:28: Shiva Baby

37:29-57:05: 5 Favorite Alcohol Related Scenes

item.title: TFR Ep. 551: Mortal Kombat, Grave Of The Fireflies, Studio Ghibli Marathon Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt try to discover their arcana and prepare to FIGHT as they discuss the ‘Mortal Kombat’ reboot.  Most of your favorites are here.  With the appropriate representation this time!  So do we finally have a TOASTY video game adaptation that’s a FLAWLESS VICTORY?  Or is it just another BRUTALITY?  We’re hoping for a FRIENDSHIP. (Listen, Chris said there would be no Mortal Kombat puns during their discussion. Write-ups are a whole different story). Then the Studio Ghibli Marathon wraps up with the legendary ‘Grave Of The Fireflies’. With a reputation as being one of the saddest films ever made, will Matt and Chris get through it without bawling like they’ve just suffered from a BABALITY?  There’s the big rundown of the important releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then the show closes with Chris and Matt revealing their winners of our Studio Ghibli Marathon Awards. So…GET OVER HERE!!!

00:00-15:46: Intro/Mortal Kombat

15:47-24:42: Physical Media Picks

24:43-32:59: 2021 Oscars Recap

33:00-42:49: Grave Of The Fireflies

42:50-52:45: Studio Ghibli Marathon Awards

52:46-54:07: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 550: Concrete Cowboy, My Neighbor Tortoro, 2021 Oscar Predictions
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt saddle up with some cowhands in the streets of…northern Philadelphia(?!?) in ‘Concrete Cowboy’.  Idris Elba appears along-side Caleb McLaughlin in this family, coming of age drama.  Are horses the key to growth, or is there something deeper going on?  Then the end of our Studio Ghibli Marathon is in sight with our penultimate film, ‘My Neighbor Tortoro’.  The story of a family resettling after a family illness and the woodland spirits they befriend.  There’s the wholesome and loving review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris close out the big show with their 2021 Oscars Predictions.  Find out who will win and who should have won.  All this and more, on this episode of The First Run.

00:00-12:03: Intro/Concrete Cowboy

12:04-22:10: Physical Media Picks

22:11-31:33: My Neighbor Totoro

31:34-50:17: 2021 Oscars Picks

50:18-52:42: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 549: The Father, Howl’s Moving Castle, TFR Libs
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with the last Best Picture nominee they hadn’t seen.  Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman star in ‘The Father’.  Up for a ton of awards and is slowly becoming the dark horse for its nominations, can the film turn Matt around on his disdain for play adaptations?  Then the Studio Ghibli Marathon continues with ‘Howl’s Moving Castle’, this time featuring the voice talents of Emily Mortimer, Lauren Bacall, and Christian Bale (much to the surprise of Matt).  There’s the exhilaration rundown of the big releases on the physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  The show then wraps with Matt and Chris playing another thrilling around of our fill-in-the-blank game, TFR Libs, featuring Kevin Smith’s NFT project, a perfect solve for the Black Panther matter, and more. As if that wasn’t enough, included is a clip from the new project featuring The Lady Wan and Chris, ScreenRun! So settle in, grab a whiskey, and let your mind wander as we listen to another episode of The First Run!

00:00-12:48: Intro/The Father

12:49-19:00: Physical Media Picks

19:01-32:11: Howl’s Moving Castle

32:12-1:00:44: TFR Libs

1:00:45-1:01:48: Wrap Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 548: Godzilla Vs. Kong, Princess Mononoke, Who Dat?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with the 4th film in the new Monster-verse series, and it’s all been building to this.  The Avengers: Endgame of modern Godzilla films is here with Godzilla Vs. Kong.  Massive kaiju fights, poor characterization, loud!  But is it good?  Then the Studio Ghibli Marathon continues with ‘Princess Mononoke’. More woke ideology about wolf kids and saving a forest.  Plus demons and curses.  Hail satan. A landmark animated film from 1997, surely put to shame by the modern technological standards.  Like Pixar or go home, right Bro?  There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week!  The big show then closes with the return of everyone’s favorite role playing game, Who Dat?!?.  Matt, bring out the gimp suit.

00:00-15:41: Intro/Godzilla Vs. Kong

15:42-24:38: Physical Media Picks

24:39-35:53: Princess Mononoke

35:54-55:11: Who Dat?!?

55:12-56:27: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.itunes:subtitle: This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with the 4th film in the new Monster-verse series, and it’s all been building to this:Godzilla Vs. Kong. Then the Studio Ghibli Marathon continues with ‘Princess Mononoke’. The big show closes with the return of Who Dat!
item.itunes:summary:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt catch up with the 4th film in the new Monster-verse series, and it’s all been building to this. The Avengers: Endgame of modern Godzilla films is here with Godzilla Vs. Kong. Massive kaiju fights, poor characterization, loud! But is it good? Then the Studio Ghibli Marathon continues with ‘Princess Mononoke’. More woke ideology about wolf kids and saving a forest. Plus demons and curses. Hail satan. A landmark animated film from 1997, surely put to shame by the modern technological standards. Like Pixar or go home, right Bro? There’s the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week! The big show then closes with the return of everyone’s favorite role playing game, Who Dat?!?. Matt, bring out the gimp suit.
00:00-15:41: Intro/Godzilla Vs. Kong 15:42-24:38: Physical Media Picks 24:39-35:53: Princess Mononoke 35:54-55:11: Who Dat?!? 55:12-56:27: Wrap Up
Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 547: Nobody, Spirited Away, 5 Against Type Action Stars In Need Of A Film
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt channel their inner John Wick’s via Mr. Show with Bob Odenkirk as ‘Nobody’, a retired government super bad ass.  What happens when some steals his little girl’s kitty cat bracelet?  Or perhaps when he runs afoul of the Russian mob?  Carnage my friends.  Carnage.  Then the Studio Ghibli Marathon begins with ‘Spirited Away’.  The story of ten-year-old Chihiro adventure as she attempts to save her parents and escape a not-quite-so abandoned village and all the spirits that inhabit it.  There’s the stupefyingly wonderful review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week!  Then the show wraps with a segment in honor of Mr. Odenkirk as Matt and Chris attempt to name 5 other movie stars that could play against type and helm an action movie.  We’re looking at you Christopher Mintz-Plasse.

00:00-16:08: Intro/Nobody

16:09-26:52: Physical Media Picks

26:53-37:44: Spirited Away

37:45-52:55: 5 Against Type Action Stars In Need Of A Film

52:56-55:49: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 546: Zack Snyder’s Justice League, DCEU Future And Ranking
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the film that shall not be named.  After years of social media pressure and a streaming service’s need for attention grabbing content, it’s actually a thing. It’s time to breakdown ‘Zack Snyder’s Justice League’.  After that it’s a review of the DCEU’s next steps, if any. Plus all of the films are ranked.  There’s still time to squeeze in the big releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  So after you’ve fired up that streaming device and soaked in the 4 hours of Justice League, hang out with us for the breakdown.  My man! 

00:00-35:35: Intro/Zack Snyder’s Justice League

35:36-41:21: Physical Media Picks

41:22-01:08:53: DCEU Future and Ranking

01:08:54-01:09:56: Wrap Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 545: Psycho Goreman, Monster Hunter, Love and Monsters, 2021 Oscars Nominees
item.description:
It’s monster week on The First Run! Chris and Matt prepare to do battle, or simply just survive a triumvirate of monster movies.  The first beast unleashed is ‘Psycho Goreman’, a film that has the bacony stink of Canada all over it as a ruthless alien bad ass comes under the thrall of an entirely too bossy tween girl.  Then power couple Milla Jovovich and Paul WS Anderson returns with another video game adaptation, ‘Monster Hunter’.  This time Milla and her military unit get transported to another world filled with monsters and martial arts star Tony Jaa and surfer Ron Perlman.  Our last stop on our monster tour brings us to a post-apocalyptic Earth as we join a young man on a quest to see his true love, and all the wacky hijinks and terrifying creatures he experiences on the way in ‘Love And Monsters’. There’s the absolutely gorgeous rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. The big show closes with the Matt and Chris sharing their thoughts on this year’s recently announced Oscar nominations!  So how about that Delory Lindo…?

00:00-10:32: Intro/Psycho Goreman

10:33-17:56: Monster Hunter

17:57-29:03: Physical Media Picks

29:04-36:00: Love And Monsters

36:01-58:13: 2021 Oscar Noms

58:14-1:00:33: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Twitter

Instagram

Facebook

Chris accidentally attributes that Vox article on the Supporting Actor noms for Judas And The Black Messiah to Danielle Solzman when it was actually Emily vanDerWerff. There goes another intern.

item.title: TFR Ep. 544: Coming 2 America, Greenland, 5 Movie Fictional Products
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the sequel to one of the more beloved comedies of the 80’s,’Coming 2 America’.  Can the film possibly recapture what made the original so beloved?  Or is the sequel not only too late, but unwarranted?  Then Gerard Butler and Morena Baccarin star in the disaster film, ‘Greenland’.  But when is a disaster film not just a disaster film?  There’s the ridiculously entertaining rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then the show wraps as Matt and Chris share their 5 Favorite Fictional Movie Products.  D Terminators count? 

00:00-11:11: Intro/Coming 2 America

11:12-21:31: Physical Media Picks

21:32-30:52: Greenland

30:53-46:42: 5 Favorite Movie Fictional Products

46:43-48:43: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 543: Minari, I Care A Lot, The Lounge
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt finally leave it all behind and head out to Arkansas to start a new life as farmers and see how the Yi family is doing in ‘Minari’.  Critically acclaimed with some controversy.  Just what we like to hear.  Then after spending some time with a potentially heart-warming family drama, it’s back to New England as I attempt to get Matt confined to an assisted living facility to take over his assets, some could say ‘steal’, with my new best gal pal, Rosamund Pike in ‘I Care A Lot’.  There’s the venerable review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  The show then wraps with Matt and Chris kicking back and discussing some of the big headlines in film including Pedro Pascal, a black Superman, and Cancel Culture.

00:00-12:18: Intro/Minari

12:19-19:18: Physical Media Picks

19:19-28:14: I Care A Lot

28:15-1:01:18: The Lounge

1:01:19-1:02:14: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 542: Nomadland, Barb And Star Go To Vista Del Mar, Call It!
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt settle in with a nice, steaming bowl of hot dog soup and checked out two powerful stories about 3 dynamic women dealing with challenges in their own, unique ways.  First up, Chloe Zhao brings us ‘Nomadland’, featuring Frances McDormand.  McDormand plays a person on the outskirts of life, struggling to survive and connect with a world she no longer feels a part of.  But does she even want that connection?  Then it’s on to Florida via Nebraska with Barb and Starbara and their trip to Vista Del Mar in ‘Barb and Star Go To Vista Del Mar’.  Funny stuff or cringey non-comedy?  There’s the venerable review of the big releases on Physical Media, with the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris close out the show with another round of the life or death game of Call It!

00:00-15:31: Intro/Nomadland

15:32-21:59: Physical Media Picks

22:00-30:59: Barb And Star Go To Vista Del Mar

31:00-50:58: Call It!

50:59-52:08: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 541: Judas And The Black Messiah, Saint Maud, What Are The Odds?!?
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss a couple films that may indeed stick with you for a long time to come.  First up, Shaka King tells the story of Fred Hampton, chairman of the Illinois Black Panther Party, and his shocking assassination assisted by a member of his organization with ‘Judas And The Black Messiah’.  Then from Chicago to an unnamed English seaside town, we spend time with Maud, a private care nurse who has an unreasonable affection for the Lord, and is ready to save you at all costs… There’s the super keen rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Steaming Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then close out the show by playing another round of What Are The Odds?!? 

00:00-18:08: Intro/Judas And The Black Messiah

18:09-29:54: Physical Media Picks

29:55-38:36: Saint Maud

38:37-56:42: What Are The Odds?!?

item.title: TFR Ep. 540: The Little Things, Wolfwalkers, 5 Best Movie Cops Since 2000
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt settle in and wrap themselves up in a comfy blanket that is the Denzel thriller.  This time out its ‘The Little Things’, Denzel plays a semi-retired cop who’s brought back to his former city and dragged into a mystery that reminds him of a case that’s haunted him for years.  Plus Rami Malek and Jared Leto!  Then it’s on to the Irish animated folktale, ‘Wolfwalkers’.  It’s 1650 in Ireland and Sean Bean (who may or may not die in this one) and his daughter are brought to Kilkenny to take out the local wolf population so the settlers can farm the forest.  But there’s something out there…walking with the wolves.  There’s shockingly fun review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then the show closes with Matt and Chris sharing their 5 Favorite Movie Cops since 2000. 

00:00-13:24: Intro/The Little Things

13:25-22:12: Physical Media Picks

22:13-29:44: Wolfwalkers

29:45-46:05: 5 Best Movie Cops Since 2000

46:06-47:25: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 539: Sundance 2021 Review, Top 10 of 2020 (5-1)
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt, clearly flush with cash, buy their way into the Sundance Film Festival!  Chris and Matt settle in to the great white, West (?) and checked out ‘Censor’, ‘Eight For Silver’, and ‘Prisoners Of The Ghostland’.  But the fun doesn’t stop there!  Matt also saw ‘John And the Hole’, ‘In the Earth’, ‘Wild Indian’, ‘Strawberry Mansion’, ‘First Date’, and ‘The Blazing World’.  Wow.  There’s the truly wonderful and extensive rundown of the big releases on home video, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  And if that’s not enough, Matt and Chris close out there 10 Favorite Films Of 2020, featuring picks 5-1.

00:00-08:29: Intro/Censor

08:30-13:46: Eight For Silver

13:47-22:06: Prisoners of Ghostland

item.title: TFR Ep. 538: One Night In Miami, Sylvie’s Love, Top 10 of 2020, Pt. 1: 10-6
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt take head down to southern Florida and spend ‘One Night In Miami’.  Regina King’s adaption of the play brings Malcom X, Muhammad Ali, Sam Cooke, and James Brown together to tackle the lives and obligations to the struggle.  Can Matt be won over  after expressing last week his disdain for play adaptations?  Then it’s over to NYC in the early 60’s for ‘Sylvie’s Love’.  Tessa Thompson stars in this throwback to the romance films of that era. But can any of us find true love and happiness?  There’s the always stupendous review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the week.  The show then closes with Matt and Chris beginning to share their favorite films of 2020.  First up is part 1; films 10-6!  Will your favorites make the list?  Listen on to find out! 

00:00-13:18: Intro/One Night In Miami

13:19-23:47: Physical Media Picks

23:48-32:35: Sylvie’s Love

32:36-46:09: Top 10 Films Of 2020, Pt. 1: 10-6

46:10-48:44: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 537: Promising Young Woman, Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom, Top 5 Favorite Play To Film Adaptations
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt continue their 2020 catch up with a discussion of Emerald Fennell’s ‘Promising Young Woman’, featuring Carey Mulligan and Bo Burnham.  One of Chris’ most anticipated films of last year, Is Promising Young Woman a thin, overly preachy melodrama?  Or an artistic work that demands potentially uncomfortable conversations. Then it’s on to Chadwick Boseman and Viola Davis in George Wolfe’s ‘Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom’.  The adaptation of August Wilson’s play features Boseman’s final performance and tackles themes that transcend it’s 1927 time period.  A gorgeous film, but does it translate well to the big screen?  There’s the truly wonderous review of the big releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. Matt and Chris then wrap up the show with their 5 Favorite Play Adaptations. 

00:00-14:12: Intro/Promising Young Woman

14:13-23:14: Physical Media Picks

23:15-30:25: Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom

30:26-46:41: Top 5 Favorite Play To Film Adaptations

46:42-48:06: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 536: The 40 Year Old Version, Bacarau, 2021 Netflix Preview
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss Radha Blank’s ‘The 40 Year Old Version’, now on Netflix.  The story of a struggling playwright in New York City as she deals with the loss of her mother, considers selling out, until she is spared by a possible new endeavor.  Then Matt and Chris jet on down to Brazil and visit the small village of Bacarau, where something truly strange is afoot.  There’s the fun AND informative rundown of the major releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD an Streaming Picks of the Week.  The guys then close out the show with their 2021 Netflix preview.  Can the Rock, Gal Gadot, and Ryan Reynolds sell us all on some more straight to DVD level goodness?

00:00-14:14: Intro/The 40 Year Old Version

14:15-25:31: Physical Media Picks

25:32-32:59: Bacarau

33:00-47:39: 2021 Netflix Preview 

47:40-49:58: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 535: Soul, The Midnight Sky, 5 Favorite Films Directed By An Actor
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt celebrate the New Year with some ‘Soul’ and some Clooney.  First up, Pixar’s latest film ‘Soul’ is live on Disney+ without an additional fee.  Joe Gardner is a middle school music teacher who meets a fortunate not-quite end.  Is he able to force a second chance or is he destined to burn in the pits of hell for all eternity?  Something like that.  Then Matt and Chris discuss the George Clooney helmed picture, ‘The Midnight Sky’. Clooney is possibly the only survivor of a doomed planet desperate to communicate to a group of astronauts on their way back to Earth that maybe they may want to pull a u-turn and head out somewhere else.  But can he do it in time?  And is he alone…?  There’s the ravishing rundown of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show then wraps with Chris and Matt sharing the 5 Favorite Films Directed By An Actor.  So let’s crank this baby up to 11 and start the festivities.

00:00-12:31: Intro/Soul

12:32-20:22: Physical Media Picks

20:23-31:22: The Midnight Sky

31:23-52:00: 5 Favorite Films Directed By An Actor

52:01-53:28: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

item.title: TFR Ep. 534: Wonder Woman 1984, Salò, Banned Marathon Awards
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss a pair of films about corruption, one potentially full of fun in a time not so long past, and the other being Wonder Woman 1984.  Yep, our banned marathon concludes with Salo. A film with one of the worst reputations ever. Does it live up to its infamy? There will be the short review of the big releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week. The show then closes with our Banned Marathon “Awards”, such as they are.... So let’s start with the past continuing adventures of one Diana Prince.

00:00-21:34: Wonder Woman 1984

21:35-27:04: Physical Media Picks

27:05-43:35: Salò, Or The 120 Days Of Sodom

43:36-52:36: Banned Marathon Awards

52:37-54:43: Wrap Up

item.title: TFR Ep. 533: Mulan, Cannibal Holocaust, 5 Films For 2021
item.description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss possibly the greatest double feature of all time.  First up, Disney’s live action adaptation of the classic animated film ‘Mulan’.  Initially available on Disney+ at a premium price of $29.99 on top of the required membership, it’s now included at that base $7/$8 price tag.  Was it worth the wait or were we smart to pocket those $30 for other, more inappropriate expenses?  Then, we take a sharp left turn into the green inferno that is Ruggero Dedato’s ‘Cannibal Holocaust’, as our Banned Marathon continues to be the cherry on top of this hellish sundae of a year.  We’re talking week old ground beef, a banana peel, some hot dog water and a worn-out tennis shoe.  But is there a moral message for us to hang onto like a raft in a tsunami of horrible?  There’s the super-tight rundown of the big releases on physical media, featuring the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Matt and Chris then wrap up the show with 5 films they’re looking forward to in 2021.  Happy Holidays!

00:00-14:01: Intro/Mulan

14:02-17:57: Physical Media Picks

17:58-34:38: Cannibal Holocaust

34:39-52:47: 5 Films For 2021

52:48-56:40: Chris On Top Gun

56:41-57:45: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

Facebook
